Title: Cashier(student) - La Ronge, SK - Indeed.com
Description:
Lake Country Co-op invites applications for the positions of
Part Time Student Cashiers(x2)
at our
Food Store location
in
La Ronge, Sk.
Who we are:
Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy in our communities, delivering profits back and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs
Reporting to the Grocery Team Leader, responsibilities for this position include the following:
Engage and interact with guests to create a positive shopping experience- in person, on the telephone and at the point of sale
Perform cashing duties, serve guests, pack groceries, stock and face shelves, perform general housekeeping duties
Demonstrate the day-to-day behaviors and actions that align with and strengthen Lake Country Co-operative’s vision, mission, values, brand and focus on safety
Why it matters:
Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our 50000 member-owners in 18 different communities. Through the work that we do and annual sales of $500 million we help to build, fuel, feed and grow our communities together.
Who you are:
You are looking for a career in Customer Service and:
You’re well organized, capable of attaining a high level of production, with a minimum amount of supervision
You’re honest and trustworthy, are results-orientated, and are proud of the work you do
You believe in building relationships and collaborating to deliver solutions that matter most, and you recognize the value that different perspectives bring to meet shared objectives.
You’re attentive to detail and have strong cash management skills
You have POS experience and have the ability to work in a fast paced, guest facing environment
You have a flexible work schedule including weekends, evenings and holidays
Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation.
At Lake Country Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we’re working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work.
We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted.

Title: Cage & Count Attendant - North Bay, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
The Gateway to Your Future
The cage is the heartbeat of the casino and is a central role in developing your skills and expanding your career opportunities. As a Cashier, you will accurately verify, reconcile, and process currency and chip transactions. If you thrive in an upbeat, busy, and vibrant atmosphere and the chance to be in the action, this role is perfect for you. A willingness to learn, team-player instincts, and a balanced sense of fun and responsibility are all part of what makes for a successful Cashier. While you work hard at maintaining our high standards in service excellence, we provide you with an excellent benefits package and a competitive salary at a national company with more than 27 locations throughout Canada.
We Provide
Full benefits package for employees
Retirement savings plan
Exciting, supportive and fun work environment
Family and friends discounts on travel, tech, food, beverage, and fitness
Development and training opportunities
Key Responsibilities
Count and verify opening and closing floats for all coin, currency, chips, and marketing items.
Exchange foreign and domestic currency.
Counts cash and value chips according to company policies and procedures.
Records transactions in Casino Management Software and verifies printed reports.
What You Bring
Minimum of six months of cash-handling experience.
Ability to add, multiply, and balance floats and spreadsheets.
Deal Us In (Phase 1) and Reel Facts VLT training available within 30 days of start (Alberta).
The ability to obtain registration with either the BCLC, AGLC or AGCO (based on province).
Ability to pull, lift, and carry objects such as a cashier tray and can transport a heavy cart.
Ability to stand for long periods.
Good manual dexterity to accurately handle cash, tickets, and chips.
A friendly, polite, patient and courteous energy.
Ability to work on your feet and provide solutions quickly.
Open to working flexible hours, evenings, and weekends.
Why Work With Us?
Gateway celebrates and empowers our team members, who make it all possible. A career at Gateway means working with great people, being recognized for your unique contribution and career advancement opportunities across our 27 locations. Our employees thrive with ongoing training and leadership programs while working in a dynamic and fun environment. See for yourself what it's like to be on a team that values your vision, skill and energy.
Get to Know Gateway
Gateway Casinos & Entertainment Limited ('Gateway') is one of the largest and most diversified gaming and entertainment companies in Canada. Across its 27 gaming properties in British Columbia, Ontario and Edmonton, Alberta, Gateway currently employs approximately 8,648 people and boasts approximately 448 table games (including 49 poker tables), 13,887 slots, 85 restaurants and bars and 561 hotel rooms. Gateway is the service provider for the Central, Southwest and North gaming Bundles in Ontario, which includes 11 properties in their portfolio. A multi-pronged growth strategy has seen Gateway diversify and expand its product offering, including developing proprietary casino and restaurant brands, dramatically improving the gaming customer experience while attracting new customers. Some of Gateway's proprietary brands include Match Eatery & Public House, Atlas Steak + Fish and the new Halley's Club. In 2017, Gateway celebrated 25 years in the business of gaming and entertainment in Canada. Further information is available at www.gatewaycasinos.com.
What Is Next
Not the right fit this time? Follow us on our careers social media pages!
In all of the jurisdictions where we operate, the provincial government and Public Health Officers (PHOs) have implemented proof of vaccination requirements for all guests of our casinos, restaurants and some amenities. The Public Health Agency of Canada (PHAC) notes that vaccination is one of the most effective ways to help protect ourselves, our families and communities against COVID-19. At Gateway, we are taking the step to implement an Employee COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. This will best ensure we are fulfilling our requirement to provide a safe and healthy environment for our employees and guests. Beginning November 8, 2021, all employees at Gateway are required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination or begin completing weekly rapid testing and adhering to mandatory mask requirements, regardless of the public health direction of mask mandate.
Gateway is a proud equal opportunity employer and dedicates itself to Respect, Integrity, Team-Work and Exceptional Customer Service. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free candidate experience and work environment. If you require accommodation at any point during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know.

Title: Cashier/Customer Service - Mississauga, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Are you ready to try something new?
Are you overdue for something fun?
Something that is challenging and rewarding?
Something exciting with great growth opportunities?
We would love for you to join us today!
Mandatory availability:
Tuesdays, will schedule hours within 9:00am to 4:00pm;
Thursdays, will schedule hours within 2:00pm to 9:00pm;
Fridays, will schedule morning or afternoon shifts;
Saturdays, will schedule hours within 9:00am to 7:00pm.
We will only consider candidates with the following:
Working experience merchandising and shelf stocking,
Ability to move and lift up to 19 kgs / 40 lbs;
Working experience as a cashier;
Above average and willing to expand their product knowledge of TVs, mobile phones, and computers.
Working experience in a commissioned sales environment will be in higher consideration.
Location:
Factory Direct - Mississauga, ON
1310 Dundas St East (near Dixie Rd),
Mississauga, Ontario, Canada,
L4Y 2C5
Since opening our first store in 1995, Factory Direct has grown to become one of Canada’s largest privately owned closeout retailers.
Currently operating over 20 stores in Ontario, Factory Direct specializes in purchasing large quantities of new, refurbished, end of line, surplus and closeout brand name consumer and office products.
We currently stock over 10,000 different products ranging from computers, electronics, cellular phones, health and beauty, toys and gaming, home and garden, and other seasonal and general merchandise.
As a Factory Direct employee, your duties will include, but not be limited to:
Selling products, services and solutions by getting to know customers and helping solve their unique end to end needs;
Maintaining store merchandising standards;
Asking lifestyle questions to thoroughly understand customer needs, offers relevant services, solutions, and accessories so customer can make informed decision to complete their purchase;
Utilize all relevant sales tools to drive profitable growth;
Leverage on-line resources, tools, and peer knowledge to self train.
Working at Factory Direct will help you:
Learn first-hand how a fast-paced business operates and how commercial decisions are made;
Develop an ability to work under pressure;
Understand the strengths of working in a team and how others in different teams depended on your work;
Acquire self-management skills, the importance of being punctual, flexible, getting work done on time, and being willing to improve your own performance.

Title: Full Service Gas Bar Cashiers - Calgary, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Description:
Our Mission: "Through inspired team members we will deliver exceptional customer experiences, products, and services that sustain and grow our business and communities."
We are going
Full Service
and seeking
Gas Bar Cashiers
to join our Gas Bar team! This position reports directly to the Gas Bar Manager. Your main responsibilities will be Cashier and Pump Attendant duties.
Some of these duties include:
Provide customer service and maintain positive customer relations through the proper handling of questions, comments and complaints. Effectively work in a diverse team environment in a proficient and friendly manner.
Perform all aspects of filling appropriate fuel into vehicles and filling cylinder and automotive propane.
Perform all aspects of Gas Bar Cashier functions including but not limited to; operating the Point of Sale (POS) in an efficient manner, ensure price integrity and answering telephone.
Maintain a neat, clean and orderly location at all times.
Performs all aspects of stocking and display functions in an efficient and organized manner. Ensures display presentation and proper stick levels in the C-Store are maintained.
Responsible for adhering to regulated Tobacco/Lottery laws (i.e. age restrictions).
What skills and abilities will you need to be considered?
Grade 9 or acceptable combination of education and experience
Must be fluent in English (CLBA - Canadian Language Benchmark Assessment score of 5 or higher)
Related retail experience
Must be 16 years of age
Lifting required
What skills and abilities will set you apart from others?
Previous cash handling or related experience
Gas Bar experience
Benefits & Perks
Working at Calgary Co-op provides opportunities for increasing levels of responsibility, personal growth and challenge and the experience of working for a company that is proud of the communities it serves. We offer competitive wages, paid vacations, employee discounts, a recognition program, social committee events, and employee and family assistance plan and more....
We believe that if we take care of our team members, our team members will take care of our business. For more information please visit our career site at www.calgarycoop.com/careers.
